discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -0,0 +1,12 @@

+  --> $DIR/unnessary-error-issue-138401.rs:3:1
+   |
+LL | pub fn foo(x: i64) -> i64 {
discussion_comments.comment_body:
the best diagnostic seems like this:

```
error: missing open `(` for a `)` delimiter
  --> $DIR/unnessary-error-issue-138401.rs:3:1
   |
LL | pub fn foo(x: i64) -> i64 {
   |                           - the last matched openning delimeter
LL |     x.abs)
   |          - missing open `(` for this delimiter
LL | }
   | 
```

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -0,0 +1,12 @@
+error: unexpected closing delimiter: `}`
+  --> $DIR/unnessary-error-issue-138401.rs:3:1
+   |
+LL | pub fn foo(x: i64) -> i64 {
discussion_comments.comment_body: in this way, user know the scope of error span, and also do not got be confused why there is an `unexpected closing delimiter: `}``.
